GOD.content: God of Abraham, Isaac, Jacob, not the God of philosophers of ontotheology, but one who interrupts & retracts his order
GOD.linkedContent: God of Abraham, Isaac, Jacob, not the God of philosophers of ontotheology, but one who interrupts & retracts his order

FK.content: ontotheology destroys & institutes religion when it suspends sacrifice & prayer
FK.linkedContent: ontotheology destroys & institutes religion when it suspends sacrifice & prayer

HERP.content: acc. Heidegger, Derrida speculates, if God of ontotheology can’t be addressed by prayer or sacrifice, God beyond ontotheology would be a God to which it was possible & necessary to sacrifice
HERP.linkedContent: acc. Heidegger, Derrida speculates, if God of ontotheology can’t be addressed by prayer or sacrifice, God beyond ontotheology would be a God to which it was possible & necessary to sacrifice

HASD.content: onto-theological, metaphysical presuppositions sustain psychoanalytic theorems
theology vs. onto-theology or theiology [Aristotle’s 1st philosophy] (Offenbarung vs. Offenbarkeit)

A.content: no escaping ontologico-juridico-transcendental tradition [method], except w/ death, aporia, unique exclusion from system, “life death” no longer falls under case of what it makes possible
A.linkedContent: no escaping ontologico-juridico-transcendental tradition [method], except w/ death, aporia, unique exclusion from system, “life death” no longer falls under case of what it makes possible

A.content: Being and Time repeats all motifs of onto-theology it denies [see pp. 54-5 Judeo-Christian theology]
A.linkedContent: Being and Time repeats all motifs of onto-theology it denies [see pp. 54-5 Judeo-Christian theology]

EM.content: Sartre’s “metaphysical,” distinguished from phenomenological ontology which described essential specificity of regions, a purportedly neutral/undetermined unity of Being in-itself and Being for-itself > nothing other than unity of man and God: project of becoming God as the project constituting human-reality (atheism changes nothing)
EM.linkedContent: Sartre’s “metaphysical,” distinguished from phenomenological ontology which described essential specificity of regions, a purportedly neutral/undetermined unity of Being in-itself and Being for-itself > nothing other than unity of man and God: project of becoming God as the project constituting human-reality (atheism changes nothing)

EM.content: Sartre verifies Heidegger’s assessment “every humanism remains metaphysical,” ontotheological [see p. 118 (140n)]
EM.linkedContent: Sartre verifies Heidegger’s assessment “every humanism remains metaphysical,” ontotheological [see p. 118 (140n)]

EM.content: nous: assures proximity to itself of central being for which circular reappropriation is produced; nous: unity of absolute knowledge and anthropology, God & man, of onto-theo-teleology and humanism
EM.linkedContent: nous: assures proximity to itself of central being for which circular reappropriation is produced; nous: unity of absolute knowledge and anthropology, God & man, of onto-theo-teleology and humanism

EM.content: “l’être” et la langue est le nom de ce qui assure ce passage par le nous entre la métaphysique et l’humanisme
EM.linkedContent: “l’être” et la langue est le nom de ce qui assure ce passage par le nous entre la métaphysique et l’humanisme

VM.content: Heidegger stops using Endlichkeit, it was never Christian-theological but idea of finite Being is ontotheological
VM.linkedContent: Heidegger stops using Endlichkeit, it was never Christian-theological but idea of finite Being is ontotheological

VM.content: thought that seeks to go to its very end in its language, the end envisaged under name of finitude, should abandon words & themes of finite/infinite & everything they govern > this is the impossible of beyond metaphysics which confirms necessity for this incommensurable overflow to take support from metaphysics
VM.linkedContent: thought that seeks to go to its very end in its language, the end envisaged under name of finitude, should abandon words & themes of finite/infinite & everything they govern > this is the impossible of beyond metaphysics which confirms necessity for this incommensurable overflow to take support from metaphysics

VM.content: Heidegger realized this in making difference [btwn Being & existent] fundamental
VM.linkedContent: Heidegger realized this in making difference [btwn Being & existent] fundamental

FWT.content: Derrida wants to think the onto-theological-political through DP
FWT.linkedContent: Derrida wants to think the onto-theological-political through DP

FWT.content: what welds philosophy as ontology (in its hegemonic tradition) to political theology of DP, & to idea of “proper to man”: 1) Plato’s care for death (epimeleia tou thanatou) 2) Kant’s dignity (Würde), man as end in himself, inscribes DP w/in his law 3) Hegel’s struggle for recognition 4) Heidegger’s being-toward-death of Dasein
FWT.linkedContent: what welds philosophy as ontology (in its hegemonic tradition) to political theology of DP, & to idea of “proper to man”: 1) Plato’s care for death (epimeleia tou thanatou) 2) Kant’s dignity (Würde), man as end in himself, inscribes DP w/in his law 3) Hegel’s struggle for recognition 4) Heidegger’s being-toward-death of Dasein

FWT.content: DP, like death itself, what’s “proper to man” > DP, at risk of shocking, always answered deeply “humanist” pleas
FWT.linkedContent: DP, like death itself, what’s “proper to man” > DP, at risk of shocking, always answered deeply “humanist” pleas

FWT.content: DP the keystone, prosthetic artifact, weld, cement that keeps onto-theological upright, and all its dualities (physis/tekhnè, physis/nomos, physis/thesis)
FWT.linkedContent: DP the keystone, prosthetic artifact, weld, cement that keeps onto-theological upright, and all its dualities (physis/tekhnè, physis/nomos, physis/thesis)

FWT.content: given that DP revolves around equivalence of an eye for an eye, question of DP is not only about political onto-theology of sovereignty, but principle of reason as calculability
FWT.linkedContent: given that DP revolves around equivalence of an eye for an eye, question of DP is not only about political onto-theology of sovereignty, but principle of reason as calculability

WM.content: dominant metaphor, major signified of ontotheleogy: circle of the heliotrope
WM.linkedContent: dominant metaphor, major signified of ontotheleogy: circle of the heliotrope

OS.content: all anticipation of the meaning of time: onto-theo-teleology; time suppressed the moment one asks the question of its meaning, when one relates it to presence, truth, essence; Hegel: “time is that which erases time” > time, existence of circle, hides from itself its own totality
OS.linkedContent: all anticipation of the meaning of time: onto-theo-teleology; time suppressed the moment one asks the question of its meaning, when one relates it to presence, truth, essence; Hegel: “time is that which erases time” > time, existence of circle, hides from itself its own totality

POS.content: Derrida is “above all” made possible by Heidegger’s ontological difference (the unthought difference btwn Being and beings), yet Nietzsche is “perhaps” a move beyond the ontotheology of Heidegger, toward a differance no longer in language of West
POS.linkedContent: Derrida is “above all” made possible by Heidegger’s ontological difference (the unthought difference btwn Being and beings), yet Nietzsche is “perhaps” a move beyond the ontotheology of Heidegger, toward a differance no longer in language of West

POS.content: to risk meaning nothing is to start to play, enter play of differance which prevents any word, any concept, from summarizing or governing from a theological presence, centralizing the movement and spacing of differences
POS.linkedContent: to risk meaning nothing is to start to play, enter play of differance which prevents any word, any concept, from summarizing or governing from a theological presence, centralizing the movement and spacing of differences

POS.content: hasn’t Derrida demonstrated that trace is neither ground, foundation, origin, can’t provide for manifest/disguised ontotheology? [still, he receives such criticisms]
POS.linkedContent: hasn’t Derrida demonstrated that trace is neither ground, foundation, origin, can’t provide for manifest/disguised ontotheology? [still, he receives such criticisms]

DIF.content: differance is not, neither existence nor essence: inscribes & exceeds ontotheology w/out return
DIF.linkedContent: differance is not, neither existence nor essence: inscribes & exceeds ontotheology w/out return

DIF.content: to delimit closure of metaphysics (absolute privilege that is consciousness as meaning in self-presence) one must solicit the value of presence (this ontotheological determination)
DIF.linkedContent: to delimit closure of metaphysics (absolute privilege that is consciousness as meaning in self-presence) one must solicit the value of presence (this ontotheological determination)

O.content: dissemination displaces 3 of ontotheology along angle of a certain refolding (re-ploiement)p. 45 MOP as effacement or sublimation of seminal differance, restance of outwork gets internalized, domesticated into ontotheology of great book
O.linkedContent: dissemination displaces 3 of ontotheology along angle of a certain refolding (re-ploiement)p. 45 MOP as effacement or sublimation of seminal differance, restance of outwork gets internalized, domesticated into ontotheology of great book

O.content: Hegel’s philosophical encyclopedia, last of its kind in history to deserve the name > encyclopedia is thoroughly theological in essence/origin (despite the so-called atheistic one)
O.linkedContent: Hegel’s philosophical encyclopedia, last of its kind in history to deserve the name > encyclopedia is thoroughly theological in essence/origin (despite the so-called atheistic one)

WAP.content: deconstruction had to recognize internal destructuration of phallogocentric onto-theology, otherwise would have repeated classical logic
WAP.linkedContent: deconstruction had to recognize internal destructuration of phallogocentric onto-theology, otherwise would have repeated classical logic

WAP.content: onto-theological, phallogocentric principles of metaphysics guided by question “what is?” subordinates all fields to onto-encyclopedic instant: leads to unity of philosophical university
WAP.linkedContent: onto-theological, phallogocentric principles of metaphysics guided by question “what is?” subordinates all fields to onto-encyclopedic instant: leads to unity of philosophical university

PIO.content: tout autre not any figures of ontotheological configuration (subject, consciousness, unconscious, self, man or woman)
PIO.linkedContent: tout autre not any figures of ontotheological configuration (subject, consciousness, unconscious, self, man or woman)

PF.content: to think divisibility of trait of sovereignty deconstructs a certain fable,  certain “as if,” of the political onto-theology of sovereignty
PF.linkedContent: to think divisibility of trait of sovereignty deconstructs a certain fable, certain “as if,” of the political onto-theology of sovereignty

PF.content: how to think durable hardness, invincibility, of an onto-theologico-political phantasm: i.e. sovereignty?
PF.linkedContent: how to think durable hardness, invincibility, of an onto-theologico-political phantasm: i.e. sovereignty?

PSSS.content: all which resists psychoanalysis in the mondialisation of today, e.g. psycho-pharmacological medicine, positivist science, but mainly an archaic onto-theological metaphysics of sovereignty, individual or state (freedom, consciousness, intention, ego, will), barely scratched or thought or deconstructed by psychoanalysis—is this psychoanalysis’ own autoimmunity? its resistance?
PSSS.linkedContent: all which resists psychoanalysis in the mondialisation of today, e.g. psycho-pharmacological medicine, positivist science, but mainly an archaic onto-theological metaphysics of sovereignty, individual or state (freedom, consciousness, intention, ego, will), barely scratched or thought or deconstructed by psychoanalysis—is this psychoanalysis’ own autoimmunity? its resistance?

LI.content: [re: SEC] Derrida replaces “of God” w/ “of writing,” where iterability of the proof (of God) produces writing > name of God drawn into graphematic drift (dérive): does name of God refer to God or name of God? “perhaps” of “that it perhaps does not exist” marks fact that “possibility” of graphematics places writing (remainder) outside ontology > [God should exist but in relation to name/reference that “perhaps” does not]
LI.linkedContent: [re: SEC] Derrida replaces “of God” w/ “of writing,” where iterability of the proof (of God) produces writing > name of God drawn into graphematic drift (dérive): does name of God refer to God or name of God? “perhaps” of “that it perhaps does not exist” marks fact that “possibility” of graphematics places writing (remainder) outside ontology > [God should exist but in relation to name/reference that “perhaps” does not]

LI.content: the rest of the trace, its remains (restance), neither present nor absent
LI.linkedContent: the rest of the trace, its remains (restance), neither present nor absent

LI.content: deconstruction of onto-theological humanism (of Heidegger too) > iterability of mark beyond all human speech acts
LI.linkedContent: deconstruction of onto-theological humanism (of Heidegger too) > iterability of mark beyond all human speech acts

TN.content: connection btwn “self-touching” of “human body” [flesh] and body of Christian ontotheology, its eucharistic ecstasy par excellence [Nancy too?]
TN.linkedContent: connection btwn “self-touching” of “human body” [flesh] and body of Christian ontotheology, its eucharistic ecstasy par excellence [Nancy too?]

BSi.content: [vis-à-vis Balibar] Bodin, Hobbes—political sovereignty as mimesis of God (the sovereign sovereign): ontotheology of phrase “marks of sovereignty”
BSi.linkedContent: [vis-à-vis Balibar] Bodin, Hobbes—political sovereignty as mimesis of God (the sovereign sovereign): ontotheology of phrase “marks of sovereignty”

BSi.content: liberty & sovereignty (its limitless “I can”) are indissociable, double bind in 2 senses: 1) double injunction 2) duplicity in very concept of binding, obligation, bind, bond: stricture rather than structure, stricture that limits liberty along w/ sovereignty or sovereignty along w/ liberty
BSi.linkedContent: liberty & sovereignty (its limitless “I can”) are indissociable, double bind in 2 senses: 1) double injunction 2) duplicity in very concept of binding, obligation, bind, bond: stricture rather than structure, stricture that limits liberty along w/ sovereignty or sovereignty along w/ liberty

BSi.content: double bind [#1 above]: deconstruct ontotheology of sovereignty w/out questioning liberty in name of which we put this deconstruction to work: think liberty differently, w/in distribution of a divisible sovereignty > think unconditional w/out indivisible sovereignty
BSi.linkedContent: double bind [#1 above]: deconstruct ontotheology of sovereignty w/out questioning liberty in name of which we put this deconstruction to work: think liberty differently, w/in distribution of a divisible sovereignty > think unconditional w/out indivisible sovereignty

OG.content: Hegel privileges sound (speech, voice), because it is a hearing of an interior vibration
OG.linkedContent: Hegel privileges sound (speech, voice), because it is a hearing of an interior vibration

OG.content: voice, phonè, s’entendre-parler, s’affecte lui-même (hearing-oneself-speak, affecting oneself), ideality

phonocentrism se confond (merges) w/ onto-theology, produces these subdeterminations of presence: sight as eidos, substance/essence/existence (ousia), temporal presence as point (stigmè) of now (nun), consciousness, cogito, subjectivity, co-presence of other & self…
OG.linkedContent: phonocentrism se confond (merges) w/ onto-theology, produces these subdeterminations of presence: sight as eidos, substance/essence/existence (ousia), temporal presence as point (stigmè) of now (nun), consciousness, cogito, subjectivity, co-presence of other & self…

OG.content: signs of onto-theology/logocentrism in Heidegger perhaps means that we can’t even leave the closure we can outline (dessiner), movements of belonging/not belonging too subtle to decide
OG.linkedContent: signs of onto-theology/logocentrism in Heidegger perhaps means that we can’t even leave the closure we can outline (dessiner), movements of belonging/not belonging too subtle to decide

OG.content: that a signified must be able to “take place” in its pure intelligibility (absolute logos): the theology of the sign (perhaps this epoch, whose closure we’ve outlined, will never end)
OG.linkedContent: that a signified must be able to “take place” in its pure intelligibility (absolute logos): the theology of the sign (perhaps this epoch, whose closure we’ve outlined, will never end)

OG.content: ontotheology, the system functioning as effacing of difference
OG.linkedContent: ontotheology, the system functioning as effacing of difference

OG.content: “God’s death” & “return to finitude” belong to onto-theology they fight against > differance something other than finitude
OG.linkedContent: “God’s death” & “return to finitude” belong to onto-theology they fight against > differance something other than finitude

OG.content: the becoming-legible of nonoccidental language decentered theological prejudice
OG.linkedContent: the becoming-legible of nonoccidental language decentered theological prejudice

OG.content: ontotheology of logos (par excellence w/ Hegel): powerless, oneiric effort to master absence by reducing the metaphor w/in absolute parousia of sense/meaning (sens)
OG.linkedContent: ontotheology of logos (par excellence w/ Hegel): powerless, oneiric effort to master absence by reducing the metaphor w/in absolute parousia of sense/meaning (sens)

OG.content: for Rousseau, what never should have arrived, did [i.e. the supplement]; for Plato, for all onto-theology, meaning put out of play (le sens est mis hors jeu) in condemnation of art > Rousseau does not affirm (play/game of) writing but resigns himself to it
OG.linkedContent: for Rousseau, what never should have arrived, did [i.e. the supplement]; for Plato, for all onto-theology, meaning put out of play (le sens est mis hors jeu) in condemnation of art > Rousseau does not affirm (play/game of) writing but resigns himself to it

OG.content: theory of sensible origin of ideas (attention > imagination > pictogram), Cartesian critique of Leibnizian rationalism: no intact theological, metaphysical base
OG.linkedContent: theory of sensible origin of ideas (attention > imagination > pictogram), Cartesian critique of Leibnizian rationalism: no intact theological, metaphysical base

OG.content: sensible origin coincides w/ concept of sign as original sin > if experience is relation w/ plenitude, sign always a sign of the fall [Husserl, Hegel, ontotheology]
OG.linkedContent: sensible origin coincides w/ concept of sign as original sin > if experience is relation w/ plenitude, sign always a sign of the fall [Husserl, Hegel, ontotheology]

OG.content: model of Fall (Platonic or Judeo-Christian) can only be stated w/in common closure
OG.linkedContent: model of Fall (Platonic or Judeo-Christian) can only be stated w/in common closure

EU.content: for Schelling, ethics (raised to a point beyond determination) makes us similar to God, onto-theological translation w/out rupture > a risk of totalizing absolutization of State (which Kant would deem dangerous)
EU.linkedContent: for Schelling, ethics (raised to a point beyond determination) makes us similar to God, onto-theological translation w/out rupture > a risk of totalizing absolutization of State (which Kant would deem dangerous)

EU.content: ontological-encyclopedic hegemony/structure, univerticality, tends to immobilize all recognized borders > all-powerful & powerless (destiny of philosophy subjected to State power)
EU.linkedContent: ontological-encyclopedic hegemony/structure, univerticality, tends to immobilize all recognized borders > all-powerful & powerless (destiny of philosophy subjected to State power)

EU.content: CIPH will outline different topology: horizontal, transversal, heterogenous > experiment
EU.linkedContent: CIPH will outline different topology: horizontal, transversal, heterogenous > experiment

EU.content: thought of sendoff (envoi), dispensation or gift of being: one of most powerful/singular attempts to think history/structure of onto-theology: Shickung, Schicksal, Gabe, “es gibt Sein,” “es gibt Zeit” do not seem to belong w/in onto-theological philosophemes
EU.linkedContent: thought of sendoff (envoi), dispensation or gift of being: one of most powerful/singular attempts to think history/structure of onto-theology: Shickung, Schicksal, Gabe, “es gibt Sein,” “es gibt Zeit” do not seem to belong w/in onto-theological philosophemes
